title: Words in Vector Space
concept: A 2D scatter plot showing word embeddings projected into two dimensions. Four distinct semantic clusters are visible: animals (dog, puppy, cat, kitten), royalty (king, queen, prince), technology (computer, software, algorithm), and food (pizza, sushi, pasta). The clusters are well-separated with clear labels. Between the animal and royalty clusters, a dashed arrow shows the famous 'king - man + woman = queen' vector arithmetic. The visualization makes the abstract idea of 'meaning as geometry' concrete.

format.bleed: Full bleed, no borders, no frames

axes.note: Axes present but unlabeled — these are abstract dimensions, not interpretable features
axes.style: Thin lines with subtle arrow heads

word_labels.font: Small sans-serif, positioned next to each dot
word_labels.note: Each word is labeled. Dots are small circles (5-8px). Labels offset to avoid overlap.

arrows.label: gender
arrows.note: These two arrows should be roughly parallel

subtitle.text: t-SNE / UMAP projection of word embeddings

bottom_note.text: Similar meanings → nearby coordinates. Like GPS in meaning-space.

color_palette_summary.note: Four cluster colors, one per semantic group. Warm cream background.

style_summary.technique: Clean scatter plot with labeled clusters. Minimal chart decoration.
style_summary.influences: Academic paper figures, TensorFlow Embedding Projector screenshots simplified

critical_requirements: Four distinct clusters with clear separation
Every word dot MUST be labeled
The king-queen vector arithmetic MUST be shown with parallel arrows
Cluster names (Animals, Royalty, etc.) as labels with matching colors
Readable from the back of a lecture hall
